newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Home and office construction up in Singapore in Q4.
newsitem.headline: Home and office construction up in Singapore in Q4.

text.p: Private residential units and office space under construction in Singapore rose in the fourth quarter of 1996 from the previous quarter while shop space under construction fell, the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) said.

The URA said in its quarterly release on potential supply and occupancy on Friday that the number of private residential units under construction increased by 7.6 percent to 44,395 units at the end of the fourth quarter.
The occupancy rate of new homes fell 0.4 percent to 93.8 percent in the fourth quarter.
The URA said 11,520 new private homes were launched for sale in 1996, marking a 20 percent increase over the 9,562 units launched the previous year.
Office space under construction rose 11.3 percent to 1.2 million square metres by the end of the fourth quarter while the office occupancy rate fell 0.5 percent to 91.5 percent in the same period.
Shop space under construction fell 8.2 percent to 374,900 square metres in the fourth quarter. Occupancy rose 1.1 percent to 92.4 percent.
